page.title: 03A Sanquhar Family
page.content: Many families in Sanquhar can trace their family tree through 4 or 5 generations, and some even longer. Others, however, are "incomers" to the area. The Brydsons moved here in 1976 when Mr Brydson was appointed as a Social Worker employed by the Regional Council. His work takes him to many of the nearby villages. Mrs Brydson is a teacher in the local primary school and has been involved with some of the youth organisations in the town.Their two daughters, aged 12 and 16, both attend Sanquhar Academy and are active members of the town's Silver Band, attending the twice-weekly rehearsals. Both parents were born in Dumfries & Galloway, and at weekends the family often visits their many relatives who live in the region. To further their education the girls will reluctantly have to leave Sanquhar.
